intro: Triumfetta hintonii, commonly known as the African velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It is a shrub or small tree that typically grows to a height of 2 to 5 meters. The plant has opposite, ovate leaves that are usually hairy, giving it a velvety texture. Its small, pale yellow flowers are followed by distinctive, three-lobed seed pods. Triumfetta hintonii is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
